patterns: What are the five pillars of Islam?
What is the significance of Eid al-Fitr?
responses: Islam is a monotheistic religion followed by Muslims.
Islam means submission to the will of Allah.
Prophet Muhammad is the last messenger of Allah in Islam.
The Quran is the holy book of Islam, believed to be the word of Allah.
The five pillars of Islam are Shahada, Salat, Zakat, Sawm, and Hajj.
Muslims pray five times a day facing the Kaaba in Mecca.
Ramadan is the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar, observed by fasting from dawn until sunset.
Hajj is the pilgrimage to the holy city of Mecca, a mandatory religious duty for Muslims.
Eid al-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated with prayers, feasts, and charity.
Zakat is the obligatory giving of a set percentage of one's wealth to charity in Islam.
